intro: Deinandra frutescens, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery orange to red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with dense, spiny stems and narrow, fleshy leaves. Its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Deinandra frutescens is well adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
